item.title: Row over 22 illustrations in Constitution: A look at the art, the artists, and the message
item.dc:creator: Vandana Kalra

media:content.media:title: The Preamble page has intricate patterns sketched by Beohar Rammanohar Sinha.
The Bull Seal, excavated from the Indus Valley region, is the first pictorial representation in the Constitution.

The borders of Netaji’s picture recall his message to Mahatma Gandhi on the Azad Hind Radio in 1944: “Father of our Nation, in this holy war for India’s liberation, we ask for your blessings and good wishes.” (Photo courtesy: DAG)
